title.narrative: SPECIALIZED JUSTICE SYSTEM

description.narrative: The specialized criminal justice system has developed its normative framework (legislation, policies, socio-educational model) and staff's capacities to implement social-educational models and social reintegration of adolescents in conflict with the law, guided by a focus on children's rights., which contributes to Justice For Children, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 3. By 2021, the country has a better system to protect against violence in its various forms in the selected municipalities and departments

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The specialized criminal justice system has developed its normative framework (legislation, policies, socio-educational model) andstaff's capacities to implement social-educational models and social reintegration of adolescents in conflict with the law, guidedby a focus on children's rights.

description.narrative: At the forefront in Latin America and the Caribbean, the National Institute of Juvenile Justice System, with support from UNICEF, developed and approved the National Policy for the Social Reintegration of Adolescents in Conflict with the Law, its operational plan and the case management and care model to monitor the situation of adolescents, promote their rights and strengthen their life skills. In 2021, 305 adolescents in conflict with the law were reintegrated or continued their education, while 83 officials were trained in professional competencies to apply evidence-based care models. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:27/01/2022
